009package com.weather.sdk.client;
010
011import com.weather.sdk.exception.ApiKeyException;
012import com.weather.sdk.exception.CityNotFoundException;
013import com.weather.sdk.exception.NetworkException;
014import com.weather.sdk.exception.RateLimitException;
015import com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData;
016
017/**
018 * Contract for OpenWeatherAPI HTTP integration providing weather data retrieval capabilities.
019 *
020 * <p>This interface defines the contract for communicating with the OpenWeatherAPI service to fetch
021 * current weather data for specified cities. It handles all HTTP communication details, response
022 * parsing, error handling, and provides thread-safe operations.
023 *
024 * <h2>API Integration Details</h2>
025 *
026 * <ul>
027 *   <li><strong>Base URL</strong>: https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather
028 *   <li><strong>Method</strong>: HTTP GET
029 *   <li><strong>Format</strong>: JSON response
030 *   <li><strong>Authentication</strong>: API key via query parameter
031 *   <li><strong>Units</strong>: Metric (Celsius, meters/second)
032 * </ul>
033 *
034 * <h2>Request Format</h2>
035 *
036 * <p>Requests are constructed with the following parameters:
037 *
038 * <ul>
039 *   <li><code>q</code>: City name (required)
040 *   <li><code>appid</code>: API key (required)
041 *   <li><code>units</code>: Units system (always "metric")
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <p>Example URL:
045 *
046 * <pre>
047 * https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?q=London&amp;appid=your-api-key&amp;units=metric
048 * </pre>
049 *
050 * <h2>Response Mapping</h2>
051 *
052 * <p>The API returns weather data in JSON format which is mapped to {@link WeatherData}:
053 *
054 * <ul>
055 *   <li><code>weather[0].main</code> → {@link WeatherData#getWeather() getWeather().getMain()}
056 *   <li><code>weather[0].description</code> → {@link WeatherData#getWeather()
057 *       getWeather().getDescription()}
058 *   <li><code>main.temp</code> → {@link WeatherData#getTemperature() getTemperature().getTemp()}
059 *   <li><code>main.feels_like</code> → {@link WeatherData#getTemperature()
060 *       getTemperature().getFeelsLike()}
061 *   <li><code>wind.speed</code> → {@link WeatherData#getWind() getWind().getSpeed()}
062 *   <li><code>wind.deg</code> → {@link WeatherData#getWind() getWind().getDirection()}
063 *   <li><code>sys.sunrise</code> → {@link WeatherData#getSystemInfo() getSystemInfo().getSunrise()}
064 *   <li><code>sys.sunset</code> → {@link WeatherData#getSystemInfo() getSystemInfo().getSunset()}
065 * </ul>
066 *
067 * <h2>Error Handling</h2>
068 *
069 * <p>The interface provides comprehensive error handling for various failure scenarios:
070 *
071 * <ul>
072 *   <li><strong>200 OK</strong>: Success - Parse JSON to WeatherData
073 *   <li><strong>401 Unauthorized</strong>: Throw {@link ApiKeyException}
074 *   <li><strong>404 Not Found</strong>: Throw {@link CityNotFoundException}
075 *   <li><strong>429 Too Many Requests</strong>: Throw {@link RateLimitException} (includes
076 *       Retry-After header)
077 *   <li><strong>5xx Server Error</strong>: Throw {@link NetworkException}
078 *   <li><strong>Network Failure</strong>: Throw {@link NetworkException}
079 * </ul>
080 *
081 * <h2>Error Response Format</h2>
082 *
083 * <p>OpenWeatherAPI returns error responses in JSON format:
084 *
085 * <pre>
086 * {
087 *   "cod": "404",
088 *   "message": "city not found"
089 * }
090 * </pre>
091 *
092 * <h2>Thread Safety</h2>
093 *
094 * <p>This interface and its implementations are designed to be thread-safe:
095 *
096 * <ul>
097 *   <li>Can be called concurrently from multiple threads
098 *   <li>No external synchronization required
099 *   <li>Each call is independent and thread-local
100 * </ul>
101 *
102 * <h2>Usage Example</h2>
103 *
104 * <pre>
105 * // Create client instance
106 * OpenWeatherApiClient client = new DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient();
107 *
108 * // Fetch weather data for a city
109 * try {
110 *   WeatherData weather = client.fetchWeather("London", "your-api-key");
111 *   System.out.println("Temperature: " + weather.getTemperature().getTempCelsius() + "°C");
112 *   System.out.println("Conditions: " + weather.getWeather().getDescription());
113 * } catch (ApiKeyException e) {
114 *   System.err.println("Invalid API key: " + e.getMessage());
115 * } catch (CityNotFoundException e) {
116 *   System.err.println("City not found: " + e.getMessage());
117 * } catch (RateLimitException e) {
118 *   System.err.println("Rate limit exceeded. Retry after: " + e.getRetryAfterSeconds() + " seconds");
119 * } catch (NetworkException e) {
120 *   System.err.println("Network error: " + e.getMessage());
121 * }
122 * </pre>
123 *
124 * @see WeatherData
125 * @see NetworkException
126 * @see RateLimitException
127 * @see ApiKeyException
128 * @see CityNotFoundException
129 * @since 1.0.0
130 */
131public interface OpenWeatherApiClient {
132
133  /** Base URL for the OpenWeatherAPI current weather endpoint. */
134  String API_ENDPOINT_URL = "https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather";
135
136  /** Query parameter name for city name. */
137  String PARAM_CITY = "q";
138
139  /** Query parameter name for API key. */
140  String PARAM_API_KEY = "appid";
141
142  /** Query parameter name for units system. */
143  String PARAM_UNITS = "units";
144
145  /** Value for metric units system. */
146  String UNITS_METRIC = "metric";
147
148  /** Value for standard units system (returns temperatures in Kelvin). */
149  String UNITS_STANDARD = "standard";
150
151  /**
152   * Fetches current weather data for the specified city.
153   *
154   * <p>This method makes an HTTP GET request to the OpenWeatherAPI service to retrieve current
155   * weather information for the given city. The method handles all aspects of the HTTP
156   * communication including request construction, response parsing, and error handling.
157   *
158   * <h4>Request Construction</h4>
159   *
160   * <ul>
161   *   <li>URL: {@value #API_ENDPOINT_URL}
162   *   <li>Method: GET
163   *   <li>Parameters: q={cityName}, appid={apiKey}, units=metric
164   *   <li>Headers: Accept: application/json
165   *   <li>Timeout: Uses configured connection and read timeouts
166   * </ul>
167   *
168   * <h4>Response Handling</h4>
169   *
170   * <ul>
171   *   <li><strong>HTTP 200</strong>: Parse JSON response to {@link WeatherData}
172   *   <li><strong>HTTP 401</strong>: Throw {@link ApiKeyException}
173   *   <li><strong>HTTP 404</strong>: Throw {@link CityNotFoundException}
174   *   <li><strong>HTTP 429</strong>: Throw {@link RateLimitException}
175   *   <li><strong>HTTP 5xx</strong>: Throw {@link NetworkException}
176   *   <li><strong>Network failure</strong>: Throw {@link NetworkException}
177   * </ul>
178   *
179   * <h4>Thread Safety</h4>
180   *
181   * This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently by multiple threads.
182   *
183   * @param cityName the name of the city to fetch weather for (must not be null or empty)
184   * @param apiKey the OpenWeatherAPI authentication key (must not be null or empty)
185   * @return the current weather data for the specified city
186   * @throws ApiKeyException if the API key is invalid, missing, or unauthorized
187   * @throws CityNotFoundException if the specified city cannot be found
188   * @throws RateLimitException if the API rate limit has been exceeded
189   * @throws NetworkException if a network error occurs during the request
190   */
191  WeatherData fetchWeather(String cityName, String apiKey)
192      throws ApiKeyException, CityNotFoundException, RateLimitException, NetworkException;
193}
